00045 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00046  * @brief Deinitialize the specified BFTM registers to their default values.
00047  * @param HT_BFTMn: where the HT_BFTMn is the selected BFTM from the BFTM peripherals.
00048  * @retval None
00049  ************************************************************************************************************/
00050 void BFTM_DeInit(HT_BFTM_TypeDef* HT_BFTMn)
00051 {
00052   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00053 
00054   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00055   Assert_Param(IS_BFTM(HT_BFTMn));
00056 
00057   if (HT_BFTMn == HT_BFTM0)
00058   {
00059     RSTCUReset.Bit.BFTM0 = 1;
00060   }
00061   #if (LIBCFG_BFTM1)
00062   else if (HT_BFTMn == HT_BFTM1)
00063   {
00064     RSTCUReset.Bit.BFTM1 = 1;
00065   }
00066   #endif
00067   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00068 }
00069 
00070 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00071  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified BFTM.
00072  * @param HT_BFTMn: where the HT_BFTMn is the selected BFTM from the BFTM peripherals.
00073  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00074  * @retval None
00075  ************************************************************************************************************/
00076 void BFTM_EnaCmd(HT_BFTM_TypeDef* HT_BFTMn, ControlStatus NewState)
00077 {
00078   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00079   Assert_Param(IS_BFTM(HT_BFTMn));
00080   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00081 
00082   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00083   {
00084     HT_BFTMn->CR |= (1UL << 2);
00085   }
00086   else
00087   {
00088     HT_BFTMn->CR &= ~(1UL << 2);
00089   }
00090 }
00091 
00092 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00093  * @brief Configure the CMP register value of the specified BFTM.
00094  * @param HT_BFTMn: where the HT_BFTMn is the selected BFTM from the BFTM peripherals.
00095  * @param uCompare: Specify a value to the CMP register.
00096  * @retval None
00097  ************************************************************************************************************/
00098 void BFTM_SetCompare(HT_BFTM_TypeDef* HT_BFTMn, BFTM_DataTypeDef uCompare)
00099 {
00100   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00101   Assert_Param(IS_BFTM(HT_BFTMn));
00102 
00103   HT_BFTMn->CMP = uCompare;
00104 }
00105 
00106 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00107  * @brief Get the CMP register value of the specified BFTM.
00108  * @param HT_BFTMn: where the HT_BFTMn is the selected BFTM from the BFTM peripherals.
00109  * @retval The value of the CMP register
00110  ************************************************************************************************************/
00111 u32 BFTM_GetCompare(HT_BFTM_TypeDef* HT_BFTMn)
00112 {
00113   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00114   Assert_Param(IS_BFTM(HT_BFTMn));
00115 
00116   return HT_BFTMn->CMP;
00117 }
00118

00126 {
00127   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00128   Assert_Param(IS_BFTM(HT_BFTMn));
00129 
00130   HT_BFTMn->CNTR = uCounter;
00131 }

00146 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00147  * @brief Enable or Disable the one shot mode of the specified BFTM.
00148  * @param HT_BFTMn: where the HT_BFTMn is the selected BFTM from the BFTM peripherals.
00149  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00150  * @retval None
00151  ************************************************************************************************************/
00152 void BFTM_OneShotModeCmd(HT_BFTM_TypeDef* HT_BFTMn, ControlStatus NewState)
00153 {
00154   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00155   Assert_Param(IS_BFTM(HT_BFTMn));
00156   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00157 
00158   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00159   {
00160     HT_BFTMn->CR |= (1UL << 1);
00161   }
00162   else
00163   {
00164     HT_BFTMn->CR &= ~(1UL << 1);
00165   }
00166 }
00167 
00168 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00169  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified BFTM interrupt.
00170  * @param HT_BFTMn: where the HT_BFTMn is the selected BFTM from the BFTM peripherals.
00171  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00172  * @retval None
00173  ************************************************************************************************************/
00174 void BFTM_IntConfig(HT_BFTM_TypeDef* HT_BFTMn, ControlStatus NewState)
00175 {
00176   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00177   Assert_Param(IS_BFTM(HT_BFTMn));
00178   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00179 
00180   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00181   {
00182     HT_BFTMn->CR |= BFTM_INT_MATCH;
00183   }
00184   else
00185   {
00186     HT_BFTMn->CR &= ~BFTM_INT_MATCH;
00187   }
00188 }
00189 
00190 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00191  * @brief Get the flag status of the specified BFTM.
00192  * @param HT_BFTMn: where the HT_BFTMn is the selected BFTM from the BFTM peripherals.
00193  * @retval SET or RESET
00194  ************************************************************************************************************/
00195 FlagStatus BFTM_GetFlagStatus(HT_BFTM_TypeDef* HT_BFTMn)
00196 {
00197   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00198   Assert_Param(IS_BFTM(HT_BFTMn));
00199 
00200   if (HT_BFTMn->SR & BFTM_FLAG_MATCH)
00201   {
00202     return SET;
00203   }
00204   else
00205   {
00206     return RESET;
00207   }
00208 }
00209 
00210 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00211  * @brief Clear the interrupt flag of the specified BFTM.
00212  * @param HT_BFTMn: where the HT_BFTMn is the selected BFTM from the BFTM peripherals.
00213  * @retval None
00214  ************************************************************************************************************/
00215 void BFTM_ClearFlag(HT_BFTM_TypeDef* HT_BFTMn)
00216 {
00217   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00218   Assert_Param(IS_BFTM(HT_BFTMn));
00219 
00220   HT_BFTMn->SR &= ~BFTM_FLAG_MATCH;
00221 
00222   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00223   /* DSB instruction is added in this function to ensure the write operation which is for clearing interrupt*/
00224   /* flag is actually completed before exiting ISR. It prevents the NVIC from detecting the interrupt again */
00225   /* since the write register operation may be pended in the internal write buffer of Cortex-Mx when program*/
00226   /* has exited interrupt routine. This DSB instruction may be masked if this function is called in the     */
00227   /* beginning of ISR and there are still some instructions before exiting ISR.                             */
00228   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00229   __DSB();
00230 }

00232   * @}
00233   */
